blog.name: charlesonthemovies
blog.title: Charles on the Movies
blog.description: I love movies: sci-fi, fantasy, action, comedy, drama, blockbusters, indies, pretty much everything except horror. I don't get to watch as many as I'd like, but when I do, I post about them here.

blog.name: twinkletwinklelittledream
blog.title: I Lie Awake And Scream And Scream

summary: When I went to the cinema yesterday the trailer for Captain Marvel came on and I just heard these fuckwits behind me going "ugh,...
body: When I went to the cinema yesterday the trailer for Captain Marvel came on and I just heard these fuckwits behind me going “ugh, they’re remaking all these superheroes to be female now hur dur,” and I had to stop myself from turning around and educating their dumb asses.

tags: กัปตันมาร์เวล
ตัวอย่างหนังใหม่
หนังผจญภัย
หนังแอคชั่น
title: Captain Marvel
body:
เรื่องย่อ Captain Marvel กัปตันมาร์เวล

Captain Marvel 2019 เป็นเรื่องราวของของแครอล แดนเวอร์ส หรือ กัปตัน มาร์เวล ฮีโร่ที่ทรงพลังที่สุดในจักรวาลมาร์เวล กับการปกป้องโลกจากสงครามระดับจักรวาลระหว่างเอเลี่ยน 2 เผ่าพันธุ์ มาร์เวล สตูดิโอส์ จะพาเราไปพบกับการผจญภัยที่คุณไม่เคยเห็นมาก่อนในประวัติศาสตร์ของจักรวาลภาพยนตร์มาร์เวล พบกัน มีนาคม 2562

Captain Marvel คือใคร?

ก่อนจะพูดถึงฉบับหนัง…

View On WordPress

blog.name: dear-marvel-studios
blog.title: Dear Marvel Studios
blog.description:
Welcome to the HQ of the Dear Marvel Studios project, a video that will commemorate the end of 10 years of Marvel and the end of an era in the MCU. We will need a massive number of fans to take part in our video so if you're interested in having your voice heard make sure to follow this blog and keep an eye out for future posts! 
*ALL TOPICS ANNOUNCED*

title: Topic 4: Making the movies happen
body:
Topic 4 is the time to show our appreciation for the sung and unsung heroes of Marvel!

“Whose work do you particularly appreciate in Marvel? Why?”

Discuss your favourite Marvel worker! Whether it be an actor or one really specific camera operator, tell us why you think they add to the movies in an unparalleled way.

However, while I’m sure there will be plenty of people willing to talk about Tom Holland and his amazing acting, please remember that there are more than just the actors on the sets. Personally I adore Alan Silvestri’s music and would love to talk about him! Maybe you’re a big fan of the Russo’s or

                        ❤️ Taiki Waititi ❤️

and want to discuss the directorial side of things!

Just bear in mind that while we do need people to talk about RDJ and the like, perhaps consider adding in a bit about a more obscure contributor to the movies! (This will also increase your chances of being used in the final cut)

Don’t forget to read the rules and guidelines before submitting to our Google Drive.

title: Topic 3: Marvel Appreciation
body:
Topic 3 is your one and only chance to get sappy.

“Why do you continue to watch Marvel?”

“What does Marvel mean to you?”

Basically you tell us what you think Marvel does well as a company/in their movies and why you’re a fan. (You could also tell them what they don’t do well!)

Many people complain about over-saturation in Marvel, so why do you stick around for the same characters over and over again?

Don’t forget to read the rules and guidelines before submitting to our Google Drive.

blog.name: dear-marvel-studios
blog.title: Dear Marvel Studios
blog.description:
Welcome to the HQ of the Dear Marvel Studios project, a video that will commemorate the end of 10 years of Marvel and the end of an era in the MCU. We will need a massive number of fans to take part in our video so if you're interested in having your voice heard make sure to follow this blog and keep an eye out for future posts! 
*ALL TOPICS ANNOUNCED*

title: Topic 2: Characters
body:
Topic 2 is your time to gush about your faves!

The questions you need to answer are:

“Who is your favourite character in the MCU? Why?”

“What is a shot or moment that has stuck with you?”

Please keep your videos relatively short and tame ie. no threatening Marvel workers for killing so-and-so.

Don’t forget to read the rules and guidelines before submitting to our Google Drive.

summary: Some quick notes: The cheapest way to catch up on Carol comics is to subscribe to Marvel Unlimited for $9.99 a month and binge...
caption:
Some quick notes:

  • The cheapest way to catch up on Carol comics is to subscribe to Marvel Unlimited for $9.99 a month and binge your way through her backstory.
  • This is not an exhaustive list of Carol’s appearances. Check out Crushing Krisis if you want that list.
  • Indented titles are not part of Carol’s main solo line and can generally be skipped. They were chosen either because they’re fun side jaunts or because they contain important characterization.
  • The fullest, most up-to-date version of this guide is available here.
  • Comments, corrections, questions welcome! 

THE MODERN ERA

In 2012, Carol Danvers traded her old alias of Ms. Marvel for the mantle of Captain Marvel. Kelly Sue DeConnick helmed the relaunch, and her pitch of “Carol Danvers as Chuck Yaegar” reimagined the character for a whole new era. This is the best place to start reading.

Captain Marvel (2012) #1-17 + The Enemy Within
By Kelly Sue DeConnick et al.
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

Read The Enemy Within storyline in this order on Unlimited: 

  • Avengers: The Enemy Within #1
  • Avengers Assemble #16
  • Captain Marvel #13
  • Avengers Assemble #17
  • Captain Marvel #14

And then continue with Captain Marvel #15.

Avenging Spider-Man (2011) #9-10
By Kelly Sue DeConnick
Unlimited | Trade

Avengers Assemble (2012) #9-13
By Kelly Sue DeConnick
Unlimited | Trade

Captain Marvel (2014) #1-15
By Kelly Sue DeConnick et al.
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

Captain Marvel & The Carol Corps (2015) #1-4
By Kelly Sue DeConnick & Kelly Thompson
Unlimited | Trade*

Captain Marvel (2016) #1-10
By Tara Butters & Michelle Fazekas and Ruth & Christos Gage
Unlimited | Trade

A-Force (2016) #1-10
By G. Willow Wilson & Kelly Thompson
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

Ultimates (2015) #1-12
By Al Ewing
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

Ultimates 2 (2016) #1-9, 100
By Al Ewing
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

The Mighty Captain Marvel (2017) #0-9, 125-130
By Margaret Stohl
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03

Infinity Countdown: Captain Marvel (2018) #1
By Jim McCann
Unlimited

The Life of Captain Marvel (2018) #1-5
By Margaret Stohl
Unlimited | Trade

Captain Marvel (2019) #1-?
By Kelly Thompson
Forthcoming!!

THE CLASSIC ERA

Between 1968 and 2012, Carol had a grand total of two titles of her own: 1977’s and 2006’s Ms. Marvel. Because of the large spread of time between the two, they may be read in any order. This section also includes some of the more Carol-heavy stories from other books to help fill in the gaps. While Carol is historically associated with the Avengers, most of her development in the eighties took place in the pages of Uncanny X-Men. She was largely forgotten during the nineties until writer Kurt Busiek began featuring her as an Avenger.

Her first appearance:

Marvel Super-Heroes (1963) #12-13
By Stan Lee & Roy Thomas
Unlimited | Trade

Ms. Marvel (1977) #1-23
By Gerry Conway & Chris Claremont
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

Marvel Super-Heroes (1990) #10-11
By Chris Claremont
Trade*

Not available in digital format. This pair of issues contains the stories Claremont originally wrote for Ms. Marvel #24-25.

Avengers Annual (1967) #10
By Chris Claremont
Unlimited | Trade*

See here for further context.

Uncanny X-Men (1963) #158-167
By Chris Claremont
Unlimited 

Marvel Fanfare (1982) #24
By Chris Claremont
Unlimited | Trade*

Following her time roaming the galaxy as Binary, Carol returned to Earth, rejoined the Avengers, and started calling herself Warbird, leading to:

Live Kree or Die
By Kurt Busiek
Trade

Read Live Kree or Die in this order on Unlimited:

  • Iron Man (1998) #7
  • Captain America (1998) #8
  • Quicksilver (1997) #10
  • Avengers (1998) #7

Ms. Marvel (2006) #1-50
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03

Giant-Size Ms. Marvel #1
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

Ms. Marvel Special #1
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

Ms. Marvel Annual (2008) #1
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

Ms. Marvel Special: Storyteller
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

ADDITIONAL READING

Ms. Marvel (2014) #1-19
By G. Willow Wilson
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03 | Trade 04

Ms. Marvel (2016) #1-?
By G. Willow Wilson
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03 | Trade 04 | Trade 05 | Trade 06

Captain Marvel: Monica Rambeau
By various authors
Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03 | Trade 04 | Trade 05 | Trade 06 | Trade 07

Or read these Monica Rambeau highlights on Unlimited:

  • Amazing Spider-Man Annual (1964) #16
  • Avengers (1963) #227
  • Avengers (1963) #279
  • Secret Wars (1984) #1-12
  • Captain Marvel (1989) #1
  • Captain Marvel (1994) #1
  • Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E. (2006) #1-12
  • The Mighty Avengers (2013) #1-14
  • Captain America & The Mighty Avengers (2014) #1-9

  • This is not an exhaustive list of Carol’s appearances. Check out Crushing Krisis if you want that list.
  • Indented titles are not part of Carol’s main solo line and can generally be skipped. They were chosen either because they’re fun side jaunts or because they contain important characterization.

Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02

Marvel Super-Heroes (1990) #10-11
By Chris Claremont
Trade*

Not available in digital format. This pair of issues contains the stories Claremont originally wrote for Ms. Marvel #24-25.

Avengers Annual (1967) #10
By Chris Claremont
Unlimited | Trade*

See here for further context.

Uncanny X-Men (1963) #158-167
By Chris Claremont
Unlimited 

Marvel Fanfare (1982) #24
By Chris Claremont
Unlimited | Trade*

Following her time roaming the galaxy as Binary, Carol returned to Earth, rejoined the Avengers, and started calling herself Warbird, leading to:

Live Kree or Die
By Kurt Busiek
Trade

Read Live Kree or Die in this order on Unlimited:

  • Iron Man (1998) #7
  • Captain America (1998) #8
  • Quicksilver (1997) #10
  • Avengers (1998) #7

Ms. Marvel (2006) #1-50
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03

Giant-Size Ms. Marvel #1
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

Ms. Marvel Special #1
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

Ms. Marvel Annual (2008) #1
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

Ms. Marvel Special: Storyteller
By Brian Reed
Unlimited | Trade*

ADDITIONAL READING

Ms. Marvel (2014) #1-19
By G. Willow Wilson
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03 | Trade 04

Ms. Marvel (2016) #1-?
By G. Willow Wilson
Unlimited | Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03 | Trade 04 | Trade 05 | Trade 06

Captain Marvel: Monica Rambeau
By various authors
Trade 01 | Trade 02 | Trade 03 | Trade 04 | Trade 05 | Trade 06 | Trade 07

Or read these Monica Rambeau highlights on Unlimited:

  • Amazing Spider-Man Annual (1964) #16
  • Avengers (1963) #227
  • Avengers (1963) #279
  • Secret Wars (1984) #1-12
  • Captain Marvel (1989) #1

  • Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E. (2006) #1-12

  • Captain America & The Mighty Avengers (2014) #1-9

If he knew about all the baggage Carol was carrying he’d run for the hills!

Or she’d punch him through a commercial airliner…
